intro: Crepis asadbarensis, commonly known as the Asadbaran hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to dry climates. Its leaves are usually hairy and linear, while the flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disk. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
